thread.title: CAIR urges investigation after Palestinian-American teen killed by Israel
thread.title_full: CAIR urges investigation after Palestinian-American teen killed by Israel

title: CAIR urges investigation after Palestinian-American teen killed by Israel
text:
Americas
CAIR urges investigation after Palestinian-American teen killed by Israel
'Amer Rabee’s killers must be held accountable,' Muslim advocacy group says, urging Congress to demand investigation
WASHINGTON
The Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR) on Wednesday called for an investigation into the killing of 14-year-old Palestinian-American Amer Mohammed Saada Rabee by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank.
“Amer Rabee’s killers must be held accountable,” said CAIR-New Jersey Director Selaedin Maksut, urging Congress to demand an investigation. “America is not only supplying the weapons that kill Americans abroad, it is aiding and abetting Israel’s impunity in war crimes and human rights violations.”
CAIR representatives joined a press conference in Clifton, New Jersey, held by the Palestinian American Community Center, where Amer’s uncle serves as a board member.
Rabee, 14, born in Saddle Brook, New Jersey, was killed by Israeli army forces in the town of Turmus Ayya in the central West Bank on April 6.
Israeli authorities claimed Rabee and two other boys threw stones at Israeli vehicles on Route 60 near the town. His family denied the claim, saying Omar was in a field with friends eating fresh almonds.
Two other Palestinian children were also injured, including one seriously, in the same Israeli attack.
